actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.
Reported to House from the Committee on Ways and Means with amendment, H. Rept. 95-1232.
Measure called up under motion to suspend rules and pass in House.
Measure passed House, amended, roll call #508 (386-12).
Measure called up by unanimous consent in Senate.
Measure reconsidered and repassed in Senate, amended.

official_title: An Act to prohibit the issuance of regulations on the taxation of fringe benefits, and for other purposes.

summary.text: (Measure reconsidered and repassed in Senate, amended) Prohibits the Internal Revenue Service from issuing any regulation between May 1, 1978, and December 31, 1979, and from issuing any proposed or final regulation which would be effective before 1980, relating to the taxation of employee fringe benefits in gross income. Requires that the application of the income tax, Federal Insurance Contributions Act, Federal Unemployment Tax Act, and withholding provisions relating to the treatment of transportation expenses paid or incurred after 1976 and before January 1, 1980, in travelling between a taxpayer's residence and place of work, shall be made fully in accordance with the rules in effect prior to the issuance of Revenue Ruling 76-453 (November 22, 1976). Excludes from gross income certain statutory or negotiated subsistence allowances received by State law enforcement officers after 1969 and before 1978 if the officers request such exclusion before April 15, 1979.

titles.title: A bill to prohibit the issuance of regulations on the taxation of fringe benefits.
An Act to prohibit the issuance of regulations on the taxation of fringe benefits, and for other purposes.
